snippet: Gregory S. Jackson, who was promoted in April to be the chief of staff to the Rutgers president amid a coaching abuse scandal, was already facing his own legal problems.
abstract: Rutgers officials say Gregory S Jackson was facing his own legal problems when he was promoted in April to be chief of staff to Rutgers president Robert L Barchi amid a coaching abuse scandal; Jackson, sued over alleged age discrimination, is the third Rutgers official to face public criticism over claims of discriminatory or abusive behavior in recent months.
